title: 2024 US Presidential election results live
US election highlights: Harris cancels speech as Trump inches closer to victory
content: Former President Donald Trump and vice president Kamala Harris faced off in a pivotal election that drew millions of voters. Trump secured early victories in Indiana and Kentucky, while Harris claimed Vermont. With polls closing in key states like Georgia, the nation awaits the outcome of this closely watched race.
summary: Former President Donald Trump and vice president Kamala Harris faced off in a pivotal election that drew millions of voters. Trump secured early victories in Indiana and Kentucky, while Harris claimed Vermont. With polls closing in key states like Georgia, the nation awaits the outcome of this closely watched race.

title: Bibi's firing of Israel defence chief draws both ire & praise
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's dismissal of Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has ignited controversy and protests across Israel. Gallant's opposition to Netanyahu's handling of the Hamas war, particularly regarding a ceasefire and the Orthodox military exemption issue, led to his removal. Critics accuse Netanyahu of prioritizing political survival over national security, while supporters argue the move brings stability.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's dismissal of Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has ignited controversy and protests across Israel. Gallant's opposition to Netanyahu's handling of the Hamas war, particularly regarding a ceasefire and the Orthodox military exemption issue, led to his removal. Critics accuse Netanyahu of prioritizing political survival over national security, while supporters argue the move brings stability.

title: Congratulations pour in, except from Russia
content: World leaders reacted to Donald Trump's election victory with a mix of caution and optimism. While some expressed hope for improved relations, others emphasized the need for unity and coordination in the face of potential challenges posed by Trump's policies.
summary: World leaders reacted to Donald Trump's election victory with a mix of caution and optimism. While some expressed hope for improved relations, others emphasized the need for unity and coordination in the face of potential challenges posed by Trump's policies.

title: Trump's erratic foreign policy set to meet 'a world on fire'
content: As Donald Trump returns to the political stage, questions arise about his foreign policy plans. Supporters believe his strong personality will influence world leaders, while critics point to his past inconsistencies. Trump's approach to the Ukraine war, his support for Israel, and his stance on China will be closely watched.
summary: As Donald Trump returns to the political stage, questions arise about his foreign policy plans. Supporters believe his strong personality will influence world leaders, while critics point to his past inconsistencies. Trump's approach to the Ukraine war, his support for Israel, and his stance on China will be closely watched.

title: Re-election set to stall criminal cases brought against Trump
content: Despite facing four criminal prosecutions, Donald Trump's election victory effectively halts legal proceedings against him during his presidency. While he can dismiss federal cases, the New York hush money case and Georgia election interference case may be delayed due to his presidential status.
summary: Despite facing four criminal prosecutions, Donald Trump's election victory effectively halts legal proceedings against him during his presidency. While he can dismiss federal cases, the New York hush money case and Georgia election interference case may be delayed due to his presidential status.

title: 'Samosa Caucus' puffs up from 5 to 6 in Congress
content: Six Indian Americans, including Suhas Subramanyam, the first from the East Coast, have secured victories in the House of Representatives elections. The incumbent Indian-American members, Ami Bera, Raja Krishnamoorthi, Ro Khanna, Pramila Jayapal, and Shri Thanedar, all retained their seats. Amish Shah is also poised for a potential win in Arizona.
summary: Six Indian Americans, including Suhas Subramanyam, the first from the East Coast, have secured victories in the House of Representatives elections.  The incumbent Indian-American members, Ami Bera, Raja Krishnamoorthi, Ro Khanna, Pramila Jayapal, and Shri Thanedar, all retained their seats. Amish Shah is also poised for a potential win in Arizona.

title: X-factor: Elon set to be Trump's Musketeer
content: Elon Musk, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, celebrates the billionaire's return to the White House. Musk's influence is expected to soar in a Trump 2.0 administration, potentially securing him a role in shaping policy and overseeing government spending.
summary: Elon Musk, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, celebrates the billionaire's return to the White House. Musk's influence is expected to soar in a Trump 2.0 administration, potentially securing him a role in shaping policy and overseeing government spending.

title: Barron anointed child, Melania jewel in crown: Expert decodes body language of Trump family members on Election Night
content: Body language expert Judi James said Melania's styling was corporate and her poses on Election Night were confident and strong. Barron who is remarkable for his 6'9'' height and is always the tallest person in every room, adopted an alpha pose standing alongside his mom and dad, the expert noted. Ivanka and Jared Kushner's importance has been diminished and thy were standing with JD Vance and Usha.
summary: Body language expert Judi James said Melania's styling was corporate and her poses on Election Night were confident and strong. Barron who is remarkable for his 6'9'' height and is always the tallest person in every room, adopted an alpha pose standing alongside his mom and dad, the expert noted. Ivanka and Jared Kushner's importance has been diminished and thy were standing with JD Vance and Usha.

title: 'Unlike Nate Silver who will try to...': 'Nostradamus' Allan Lichtman says he was wrong
content: ​On Election Night, Nate Silver announced that he was pulling his prediction model because it wasn't "capturing the story of this election night well." Nate Silver washed his hands off his final prediction that it would be a close battle and re-upped his October prediction elaborating 24 reasons that Trump could win the election. "We don't lack in explanations for why he returned to the White House," Silver wrote.
summary: ​On Election Night, Nate Silver announced that he was pulling his prediction model because it wasn't "capturing the story of this election night well." Nate Silver washed his hands off his final prediction that it would be a close battle and re-upped his October prediction elaborating 24 reasons that Trump could win the election. "We don't lack in explanations for why he returned to the White House," Silver wrote.

title: MAGA supporters enjoy The View's meltdown; Whoopi Goldberg refuses to take Trump's name
content: ​ "Think about this. She did this in two months. She [Kamala] did what she did. She was everywhere. She talked to everybody, and people didn’t come out. I don’t know why. And it doesn’t even matter. He’s now the president. I’m still not gonna say his name. That’s not gonna change," Whoopi Goldberg said on The View.
summary: ​ "Think about this. She did this in two months. She [Kamala] did what she did. She was everywhere. She talked to everybody, and people didn’t come out. I don’t know why. And it doesn’t even matter. He’s now the president. I’m still not gonna say his name. That’s not gonna change," Whoopi Goldberg said on The View.

title: Who is Donald Trump's ice maiden 'Susie' mentioned 7 times in his victory speech?
content: 66-year-old Susie Wiles was immersed in every aspect of Donald Trump's 2024 campaign. As Donald Trump described her, she is always in the background and likes to remain away from the limelight though she was with Trump at every crucial stop. Wiles traveled to Atlanta for the debate, flying to the event with Trump. She stayed with the former president as other campaign aides, and surrogates but she managed to stay away from the limelight.
summary: 66-year-old Susie Wiles was immersed in every aspect of Donald Trump's 2024 campaign. As Donald Trump described her, she is always in the background and likes to remain away from the limelight though she was with Trump at every crucial stop.  Wiles traveled to Atlanta for the debate, flying to the event with Trump. She stayed with the former president as other campaign aides, and surrogates but she managed to stay away from the limelight.

title: US election results 2024: Donald Trump, the imperial president
content: Donald Trump's projected second term promises a radical reshaping of American society, with a focus on mass deportation, the curtailing of reproductive rights, and the consolidation of presidential power. His plans, some drawn from the controversial Project 2025, include overhauling immigration enforcement, potentially detaining American citizens based on national origin, and promoting Christian nationalist policies.
summary: Donald Trump's projected second term promises a radical reshaping of American society, with a focus on mass deportation, the curtailing of reproductive rights, and the consolidation of presidential power. His plans, some drawn from the controversial Project 2025, include overhauling immigration enforcement, potentially detaining American citizens based on national origin, and promoting Christian nationalist policies.

title: Trump has won the US presidential polls, what happens now?
content: Donald Trump, in his second presidential transition, is prioritising loyalty in his appointments, including figures like Robert Kennedy Jr. and Elon Musk. This transition, managed by family and close allies, contrasts with his 2016 approach. Despite legal challenges delaying the 2020 transition, new legislation now ensures a smoother process for future transitions.
summary: Donald Trump, in his second presidential transition, is prioritising loyalty in his appointments, including figures like Robert Kennedy Jr. and Elon Musk.  This transition, managed by family and close allies, contrasts with his 2016 approach.  Despite legal challenges delaying the 2020 transition, new legislation now ensures a smoother process for future transitions.

title: Did Kari Lake, Ted Cruz, AOC, Anna Paulina Luna win elections: Latest updates
content: ​Republican Ted Cruz, another closely watched senator, won a third term in the US Senate from Texas. He defeated US Rep Colin Allred. This was another election that pollsters predicted wrong as Ted Cruz was predicted to "lose for sure". ​The race tightened in the last few weeks as Allred spent millions of dollars on TV and digital ads criticizing Cruz for his support of the state's six-week abortion ban.
summary: ​Republican Ted Cruz, another closely watched senator, won a third term in the US Senate from Texas. He defeated US Rep Colin Allred. This was another election that pollsters predicted wrong as Ted Cruz was predicted to "lose for sure". ​The race tightened in the last few weeks as Allred spent millions of dollars on TV and digital ads criticizing Cruz for his support of the state's six-week abortion ban.

title: US chooses Donald Trump: Climate change sceptic's return threatens global environmental progress
content: Donald Trump's return to the White House threatens global climate action. His pro-fossil fuel stance and potential withdrawal from the Paris Agreement could hinder emissions reduction efforts. While local initiatives may continue, the impact on international climate goals is concerning, particularly for vulnerable nations.
summary: Donald Trump's return to the White House threatens global climate action. His pro-fossil fuel stance and potential withdrawal from the Paris Agreement could hinder emissions reduction efforts. While local initiatives may continue, the impact on international climate goals is concerning, particularly for vulnerable nations.

title: 'Holy smokes! Literally nothing?' CNN anchor Jake Tapper's reaction on Election Night viral
content: ​CNN anchor Jake Tapper's shock at learning that Kamala Harris did not outperform Joe Biden's 2020 results in a single state on Election Night went viral. "Holy smokes! Literally nothing?" Jake Tapper said to CNN chief national correspondent John King who presented a grey map in front of him.“Literally not one county?” Tapper asked. And then he was shown the county-wise map in which Harris outperformed Biden by 3% in 58 counties.
summary: ​CNN anchor Jake Tapper's shock at learning that Kamala Harris did not outperform Joe Biden's 2020 results in a single state on Election Night went viral. "Holy smokes! Literally nothing?" Jake Tapper said to CNN chief national correspondent John King who presented a grey map in front of him.“Literally not one county?” Tapper asked. And then he was shown the county-wise map in which Harris outperformed Biden by 3% in 58 counties.

title: Poll 'Nostradamus' Allan Lichtman to 'assess' last night's result as keys didn't work
content: "I want to thank all the loyal members, subscribers, and viewers of our live show. We will go on and are assessing last night’s results. Please tune in on Thursday at 9 PM Eastern for a discussion of what happened and what the future holds for America. @allanlichtmanyoutube," the historian posted.
summary: "I want to thank all the loyal members, subscribers, and viewers of our live show. We will go on and are assessing last night’s results. Please tune in on Thursday at 9 PM Eastern for a discussion of what happened and what the future holds for America. @allanlichtmanyoutube," the historian posted.

title: Kamala Harris and major Dems fall silent after dismal result, Liz Cheney says 'like it or not...'
content: Kamala Harris has not spoken yet and neither conceded the election. Harris canceled her Election Night speech and all major Democrats and Dem social media handles fell silent. "All Americans are bound, whether we like the outcome or not, to accept the results of our elections," Liz Cheney posted Wednesday morning.
summary: Kamala Harris has not spoken yet and neither conceded the election. Harris canceled her Election Night speech and all major Democrats and Dem social media handles fell silent.  "All Americans are bound, whether we like the outcome or not, to accept the results of our elections," Liz Cheney posted Wednesday morning.

title: 'Project 2025 was real the whole time' posts viral as Donald Trump set to return to White House
content: Project 2025 resurfaced as the talking point after Donald Trump claimed victory in an election which was thought closer than a coin toss. Project 2025 was a 900-page policy wish list from which Donald Trump distanced himself as it was at the center of a major controversy for its conservation vision. Right-wing think tank The Heritage Foundation drafted Project 2025 and it was unveiled in April 2023. The Kamala Harris campaign resisted Project 2025 while the Republicans disavowed it.
summary: Project 2025 resurfaced as the talking point after Donald Trump claimed victory in an election which was thought closer than a coin toss. Project 2025 was a 900-page policy wish list from which Donald Trump distanced himself as it was at the center of a major controversy for its conservation vision. Right-wing think tank The Heritage Foundation drafted Project 2025 and it was unveiled in April 2023. The Kamala Harris campaign resisted Project 2025 while the Republicans disavowed it.
